posts.post_content: I have four of these in my [Sages of the Anima](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sages of the Anima) all-creature deck with [Heartwood Storyteller](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartwood Storyteller), [Primordeal Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordeal Sage), [Trench Gorger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trench Gorger), etc., and it is always worth its mana cost, even when I pay ![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol) for my 4th one (it's a mana ramp deck). In the right deck, it swings games in your favor big time. Though admittedly it is often a narrow card.
posts.html:
I have four of these in my Sages of the Anima all-creature deck with Heartwood Storyteller, Primordeal Sage, Trench Gorger, etc., and it is always worth its mana cost, even when I pay for my 4th one (it's a mana ramp deck). In the right deck, it swings games in your favor big time. Though admittedly it is often a narrow card.

Posted By: Discoduck (8/6/2011 8:25:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I remember opening up packs of Lorwyn and getting so \*\*\*ed off that this was my rare. Of all the great rares in Lorwyn, I get stuck with the sucky one. I mean, I tried to think of any way to combo it into a killer deck, but with the metagame of the time, it was just so pathetic, because everyone was running insane numbers of creatures. It wasn't good in any format, casual or not. The only kind of deck it was ok against, was a non-creature deck, which were usually the decks I wanted to play. I was rather annoyed...
posts.html:
I remember opening up packs of Lorwyn and getting so ***ed off that this was my rare. Of all the great rares in Lorwyn, I get stuck with the sucky one.
